<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 429, 222, 445]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 880, 617]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 645, 213, 660]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 661, 730, 693]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 88, 601, 106]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 150, 562, 168]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 181, 242, 199]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 211, 386, 230]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 231, 584, 266]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 287, 230, 305]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 307, 754, 346]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 364, 490, 400]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 426, 388, 444]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series \(u_{n} = a + (n - 1)d\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[248, 450, 546, 482]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{1}{2} n(a + l) = \frac{1}{2} n\left\{2a + (n - 1)d\right\}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 504, 336, 522]]<|/det|>
Geometric series \(u_{n} = ar^{n - 1}\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[248, 526, 432, 592]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r} (r\neq 1)\] \[S_{\infty} = \frac{a}{1 - r} (|r|< 1)\]  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 628, 598, 645]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 660, 158, 677]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 688, 584, 740]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 782, 243, 800]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[403, 809, 598, 845]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[403, 844, 598, 864]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[443, 871, 559, 900]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 85, 97, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 85, 143, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 84, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
On the axes, sketch the graph of \(y = (2x - 5)(x + 3)(1 - x)\), stating the intercepts with the coordinate axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 101, 920, 120]]<|/det|>

Hence

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 494, 180, 512]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 494, 557, 512]]<|/det|>
solve the inequality \((2x - 5)(x + 3)(1 - x) \leqslant 0\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 97, 144, 114]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 87, 280, 121]]<|/det|>
Evaluate \(\int_{\frac{\pi}{3}}^{\frac{\pi}{2}} \cos \frac{x}{4} \mathrm{~d}x\). You must show all your working.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 97, 920, 116]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 425, 146, 443]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 415, 364, 448]]<|/det|>
Find \(\int \left(\frac{1}{4x - 3} + \frac{1}{x^3}\right) \mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 425, 920, 444]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 97, 97, 114]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 96, 144, 114]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 92, 410, 114]]<|/det|>
Determine whether the equation

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[423, 83, 608, 104]]<|/det|>
\(\frac{(4x + 1)(3x + 2)}{5x - 3} = x + 1\) has two distinct real roots, two equal roots or no real roots.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 107, 920, 126]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 465, 146, 484]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 460, 304, 484]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\frac{12}{\sqrt[3]{x}} - \sqrt[3]{x} = 4.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 464, 920, 483]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 87, 94, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 84, 559, 106]]<|/det|>
The polynomial p is such that \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 6x^{3} + x^{2} - 12x + 5.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 117, 144, 136]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 116, 546, 136]]<|/det|>
Find the remainder when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x - 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 117, 918, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 227, 144, 245]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 227, 180, 245]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 227, 475, 245]]<|/det|>
Show that \(2x - 1\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 227, 920, 245]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 335, 180, 354]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 335, 564, 354]]<|/det|>
Hence write \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) as a product of linear factors.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 335, 920, 354]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 584, 180, 602]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 583, 818, 602]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(6\sin^{3}\theta +\sin^{2}\theta -12\sin \theta +5 = 0\) for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant \theta \leqslant 90^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 584, 920, 602]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 87, 92, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 85, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = 5\mathrm{e}^{2x - 1} + \mathrm{e}\). The tangent to the curve at the point where \(x = 1\) cuts the \(x\)-axis at the point \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent in the form \(y = mx + c\), where \(m\) and \(c\) are exact values, and hence find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 149, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 92, 94, 111]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 92, 144, 111]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 87, 625, 119]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\sin^{3}x\left(\frac{\cos \mathrm{e}x}{\cot x}\right)\) can be written as \(\sin^{2}x\tan x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 920, 111]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 465, 146, 484]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 458, 662, 488]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\cos^{2}x\tan x - \frac{1}{2}\tan x = 0\) for \(-\pi < x < \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 464, 920, 483]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 83, 94, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 81, 870, 102]]<|/det|>
Find the number of different ways the 9 letters of the word POLYMATHS can be arranged when

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 114, 144, 133]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 114, 455, 133]]<|/det|>
the O and A are not next to each other

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 114, 920, 133]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 363, 146, 381]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 363, 504, 381]]<|/det|>
the letters MATHS are together in this order.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 363, 920, 381]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 94, 100]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 81, 920, 117]]<|/det|> An experiment was carried out and values of \(y\) for certain values of \(x\) were recorded. The table shows the values recorded. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[208, 129, 789, 183]]<|/det|>
\(x\)1530456075
\(y\)1013223550
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 225, 821, 245]]<|/det|> The relationship between \(y\) and \(x\) is modelled by \(y = A\mathrm{e}^{kx}\), where \(A\) and \(k\) are constants. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 272, 144, 290]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 272, 500, 291]]<|/det|> Draw a straight line graph for \(\ln y\) against \(x\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 272, 918, 291]]<|/det|> [2] <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[228, 298, 787, 675]]<|/det|>

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 82, 920, 117]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the line in part (a) and hence find the values of \(A\) and \(k\). Give each value correct to 1 significant figure.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 413, 707, 433]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = 32x - 4x^2 - 48\) and the line \(AB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 428, 768, 448]]<|/det|>
The curve and the line \(AB\) meet the \(x\)-axis at \(A\) and meet again at the point \(B(5, 12)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 444, 883, 477]]<|/det|>
The line \(CD\) extended is parallel to the \(y\)-axis and passes through the maximum point of the curve. Find the area of the shaded region.

<mark>[9]

Continuation of working space for Question 9.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 104, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 82, 415, 101]]<|/det|>
The functions f and fg are defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 97, 601, 119]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{f}(x) = \mathrm{e}^{x^{2} + 3} \quad \mathrm{for} \quad x < 0\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 125, 609, 152]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{fg}(x) = \mathrm{e}^{2x} \qquad \mathrm{for} \quad x > \frac{3}{2}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 175, 146, 194]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 175, 346, 194]]<|/det|>
Explain why \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\) exists.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 176, 920, 195]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 268, 146, 287]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 268, 695, 287]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\) and state the domain and range of \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 269, 920, 287]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 92, 104, 111]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 87, 801, 114]]<|/det|>
In the binomial expansion of \(\left(2 + \frac{x}{2}\right)^n\), the first three terms in increasing powers of \(x\) are

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 109, 589, 135]]<|/det|>
\(b + abx + \frac{9}{8} abx^2\). Find the values of the constants \(n\), \(a\) and \(b\).
